Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Tuesday December 16), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for tuesday, december 16th. 

google faces new scrutiny as the european union plans to launch a probe into its data practices. regulators are concerned about how user data is collected and utilized across google's various services, with potential antitrust implications. this move underscores the eu's ongoing effort to tighten oversight on tech giants regarding data privacy.

amazon is expanding its footprint in renewable energy, announcing a new partnership to develop a massive solar farm in spain. this project is part of amazon's climate pledge, aiming to reach net-zero carbon by 2040. the tech giant's focus on renewable energy not only aligns with global sustainability trends but also bolsters its commitment to responsible innovation.

meanwhile, meta's latest virtual reality headset is set to hit the shelves next month, with pre-orders already exceeding expectations. analysts suggest that the advanced features and competitive pricing could redefine the vr landscape and further cement meta's standing in the ar/vr sector.

finally, chipmaker intel reports a rebound in its stock value as it announces significant advancements in its 3nm process technology. the anticipated boost in semiconductor performance is seen as a potential game-changer for personal computing and data center markets.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for tuesday, december 16th. 

google is under increased scrutiny as the european union prepares to launch a comprehensive investigation into its data practices. regulators are examining how google collects and utilizes user data across its myriad services, which may have antitrust implications. this initiative reflects the eu's ongoing commitment to tightening oversight of tech giants in the realm of data privacy.

amazon is making strides in renewable energy, announcing a new partnership to develop a large-scale solar farm in spain. this project is part of amazon's climate pledge, with a goal to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2040. the move underscores the tech giant's dedication to global sustainability and responsible innovation.

turning to the world of virtual reality, meta's latest vr headset is set to hit the market next month. pre-orders are already surpassing expectations, with analysts suggesting the advanced features and competitive pricing could reshape the vr landscape, further cementing meta's position in the ar/vr sector.

in the semiconductor space, intel reports a rebound in its stock value following significant advancements in its 3nm process technology. the potential boost in semiconductor performance is anticipated to be a game-changer for personal computing and data center markets alike.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-432 Google's Eu Scrutiny 🔍, Amazon's Solar Ambitions ☀️, Meta's Vr Surge 🥽
Podcast Description:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for tuesday, december 16th:

  • google under eu scrutiny: the european union is gearing up for an extensive investigation into google's data practices, raising potential antitrust concerns regarding their user data handling.
  • amazon embraces renewable energy: amazon announces a partnership for a large-scale solar farm in spain, aligning with its climate pledge to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2040.
  • meta's vr advancements: meta's upcoming vr headset launch is generating buzz with strong pre-orders, which could redefine the vr market with its advanced features and pricing strategy.
  • intel's semiconductor rebound: intel experiences stock value growth following significant progress in its 3nm process technology, promising a notable impact on personal computing and data centers.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image set in a futuristic cityscape, featuring a blend of key elements from google's eu scrutiny, amazon's solar ambitions, and meta's vr surge. in the foreground, a sleek, transparent skyscraper represents the tech industry under scrutiny, its shining facade reflecting coded patterns symbolizing regulatory oversight. to the left, a series of modern solar panels are integrated into the building's structure, basking in a vibrant sunrise, representing amazon's solar energy ambitions powering the city. in the background, the skyline is subtly infused with digital elements, like floating vr headsets and holographic interfaces, symbolizing meta's rise in the virtual reality space. the elements are unified through a play of light and shadow, forming a harmonious and dynamic composition that encapsulates the progressive and interconnected nature of these technological endeavors
